definition: to mix up/to confuse one thing with another
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: Do you confuse speculating with investing?
sentences.chinese: 你是否混同了投机和投资？

sentences.english: Make sure your XML design does not get in the way of normal content processing.
sentences.chinese: 要避免把XML设计混同于一般的内容处理。

sentences.english: The root of the conflict is to mix accident liability with civil liability for compensation.
sentences.chinese: 冲突的根源是将交通事故责任与民事赔偿责任相混同。

sentences.english: The five-element numbers of Hetu should not be confused with the four-image numbers of Zhouyi.
sentences.chinese: 《河图》的五行成数不能与《周易》四象数混同。

sentences.english: Do you confuse before-the-fact strategy with after-the-fact outcome?
sentences.chinese: 你是否混同了事先的计划和事后的结果？

definition: to obscure/to confuse/to mix up/to blur/to mislead
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
to establish as separate entities/to divide (a company etc) into independent entities/discrete/separate/separation (of powers etc)
to assign (to a class)/to classify as/to include
